item.title: Snowshoe Hares
item.description: Snowshoe hares are prevalent in northern boreal forests, such as those in Alaska. Capture-release studies conducted from 1999 to 2002 in Alaskaâ€™s Bonanza Creek Experimental Forest collected physical data on this species (Kielland et al., 2017). This project visualizes snowshoe hare weights in a box-and-whisker plot with a jitter overlay. It also provides some summary statistics on snowshow hare weights.
